channel.title: math.CV updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.CV updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Invariants and Automorphisms for slice regular functions : the octonionic case
item.description: arXiv:2411.16762v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We study automorphisms and invariants for the algebra $\mathbb{O}$ of octonions and octonionic slice regular functions $f:\mathbb{O} \to \mathbb{O}$.
item.dc:creator: Cinzia Bisi, Joerg Winkelmann

item.title: On distortion of quasiregular mappings of the upper half plane
item.description: arXiv:2411.16966v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We prove a sharp result for the distortion of a hyperbolic type metric under $K$-quasiregular mappings of the upper half plane. The proof makes use of a new kind of Bernoulli inequality and the Schwarz lemma for quasiregular mappings.
item.dc:creator: Masayo Fujimura, Matti Vuorinen

item.title: Uniformization of gasket Julia sets
item.description: arXiv:2411.17227v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: The object of the paper is to characterize gasket Julia sets of rational maps that can be uniformized by round gaskets. We restrict to rational maps without critical points on the Julia set. Under these conditions, we prove that a Julia set can be quasiconformally uniformized by a round gasket if and only if it is a fat gasket, i.e., boundaries of Fatou components intersect tangentially. We also prove that a Julia set can be uniformized by a round gasket with a David homeomorphism if and only if every Fatou component is a quasidisk; equivalently, there are no parabolic cycles of multiplicity 2. Our theorem applies to show that gasket Julia sets and limit sets of Kleinian groups can be locally quasiconformally homeomorphic, although globally this is conjectured to be false.
item.dc:creator: Yusheng Luo, Dimitrios Ntalampekos

item.title: Prawitz's area theorem and univalence criterion
item.description: arXiv:2308.08081v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this note we investigate the Prawitz's area theorem and establish a new univalence criterion for the locally univalent analytic functions in the unit disk, which generalizes some related results of Aharonov [Duke Math. J., 36(1969), 599-604].
item.dc:creator: Jianjun Jin

item.title: Weyl calculus perspective on the discrete Stokes' formula in octonions
item.description: arXiv:2312.06347v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Octonions are 8-dimensional hypercomplex numbers which form the biggest normed division algebras over the real numbers. Motivated by applications in theoretical physics, continuous octonionic analysis has become an area of active research in recent year. Looking at possible practical applications, it is beneficial to work directly with discrete structures, rather than approximate continuous objects. Therefore, in previous papers, we have proposed some ideas towards the discrete octonionic analysis. It is well known, that there are several possibilities to discretise the continuous setting, and the Weyl calculus approach, which is typically used in the discrete Clifford analysis, to octonions has not been studied yet. Therefore, in this paper, we close this gap by presenting the discretisation of octonionic analysis based on the Weyl calculus.
item.dc:creator: Rolf S\"oren Krau{\ss}har, Dmitrii Legatiuk

item.title: The Bohr's phenomenon for certain K-quasiconformal harmonic mappings
item.description: arXiv:2411.04094v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: The primary objective of this paper is to establish several sharp versions of improved Bohr inequalities, refined Bohr inequalities, and Bohr-Rogosinski inequalities for the class of $K$-quasiconformal sense-preserving harmonic mappings $f=h+\overline{g}$ in the unit disk $\Bbb{D}:=\{z\in\mathbb{C}: |z|<1\}$, where $f$ and $g$ are analytic functions in $\mathbb{D}$.
item.dc:creator: Vasudevarao Allu, Raju Biswas, Rajib Mandal
